text:
THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY
Novice G. Fawcett, President
COLUMBUS 10
RADIO AND TELEVISION BROADCASTING
Richard B. Hull, Director
February 7, 1959
Dr. Harry J. Skornia, Executive Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hal 1
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
Enjoyed our telephone conversation the other day in re the new
Kellogg grant and wish again to express my pleasure at the
happy outcome of our negotiations and my particular appreciation
of the vital and indispensable role you personally played in
arriving at this outcome.
Thank you for the recent enclosures of the February 2nd letter
from Maurice Seay and your January 31 and February 3rd letter to
him. Agree that the returned proposal should be re-done and
tried on other foundations. Don‘t nourish any pangs about the
"double pitch." l*m sure Maurice won*t.
Under the very good terms of the new grant it would seem to me
we have the opportunity (and the necessity) to do some creative
planning for the future. I hope NAEB has a chance to discuss
this in depth sometime, before too long.
Again, best to you and thanks for the information.
RBH/mh
Richard B. Hull, Director
Radio and TV Broadcasting
cc: Wm. Harley
FEB 1 4 1959
